info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 9:30PM EDT until July 21 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTHEASTERN MERCER...BEAVER... LAWRENCE...BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHWESTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 929 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Kittanning to Zelienople to Beaver, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, New Castle, Butler, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Vandergrift, East Palestine, Kittanning, Apollo, Shaler Township, and Plum. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
